comment: /* Modern ethics */ trying to end fight over meaning of the "modern era" - this article includes us in the modern era, contrary to the "modern philosophy" page; but all segments here are written on the meaning of modern I've tried to capture this tim

diff.*:
Line 59: Line 59:      
===Modern ethics===
 
===Modern ethics===
−
In the [[modern philosophy|modern]] era, ethical theories were generally divided between the consequentialist theories of utilitarian philosophers such as [[Jeremy Bentham]] and [[John Stuart Mill]], and [[deontological ethics]] as epitomized by the work of [[Immanuel Kant]]. This is also the era associated with the origin of [[pragmatic ethics]], especially in the work of [[John Dewey]].
+
In the current era, ethical theories are often divided between the consequentialist theories of utilitarian philosophers such as [[Jeremy Bentham]] and [[John Stuart Mill]], and [[deontological ethics]] as epitomized by the work of [[Immanuel Kant]]. The late 19th Century also saw the origin of [[pragmatic ethics]] in the United States, especially in the work of [[John Dewey]].
     
====Modern consequentialism====
 
====Modern consequentialism====
